      • computeEncodedLength

        protected void computeEncodedLength()
        Compute the precision and scale of the value

      • extractExponent

        protected int extractExponent(java.lang.String num,
                  int start)
        Given number string checks if it contains an exponent checking from start char. Exponent if given must be of the form: e+-nnn. Returns a number equal to the exponent Returns 0 if no exponent found.
        Parameters:
        num - number as a string which may have an exponent
        start - position where to start looking in string

      • precTot

        protected static int precTot(int length)
        Return the total precision of a decimal type. This information is encoded in the length. See /vobs/tristarm/incl/decimal.h: PRECTOT macro decimal(16,2) <-- '16'
        Parameters:
        length - - the length of the decimal type.
        Returns:
        the total precision.

      • precDec

        protected static int precDec(int length)
        Return the decimal precision of a decimal type (digits to right). This information is encoded in the length. See /vobs/tristarm/incl/decimal.h: PRECDEC decimal(16,2) <-- '2'
        Parameters:
        length - - the length of the decimal type.
        Returns:
        the decimal precision.

      • decLength

        protected static int decLength(int length)
        Return the storage/network size of this decimal bases on the encoded length. See /vobs/tristarm/incl/decimal.h: DECLENGTH
        Parameters:
        length - - the length of the decimal type.
        Returns:
        the decimal precision.

      • getIfxTypeName

        protected static java.lang.String getIfxTypeName(int length)
        Given the length of a decimal, return the full decimal type. Call precTot() and precDec() to calculate the 'x' and 'y' of 'decimal(x,y)'. Returns the string 'decimal(x, y)'
        Parameters:
        length - - the length of the decimal type.
        Returns:
        the decimal : e.g. 'decimal(16, 2)'
